turns.content: make a twitter thread explaining why money wins votes and not popularity. include relevant hashtags

1. Money plays a crucial role in political campaigns. It allows candidates to advertise, pay staff, and travel to meet voters. #politics
2. Without financial resources, a candidate may not have the means to effectively reach and communicate with voters. #campaignfinance
3. On the other hand, popularity does not necessarily translate to votes. A candidate may be well-liked but lack the resources to effectively run a campaign. #elections
4. In fact, research has shown that the candidate with more money often wins the election. #influence
5. This is because money allows candidates to reach a wider audience and persuade voters through targeted advertising and messaging. #voting
6. Additionally, money can be used to fund negative campaigning against opponents, which can damage their reputation and sway voters. #negativity
7. In short, while popularity may help a candidate, it is ultimately the financial resources that can make or break a campaign. #moneymatters
